title: For which values of k is the set of order pairs (2, 4), (k, 6), (4,0)? - Quora

response.answer_text: For which values of k is the set of ordered pairs (2, 4), (k, 6), (4,0) on a single line? Can I assume the bold was meant to be at the end of your question? If so the slope of the segments have to be equal to each other and to the line itself. Slope1 = (6–4)/(k-2) = 2/(k-2) Slope2 = (6–0)/(k-4) = 6/(k-4) Setting them equal to the known slope of (4–0)/(2-4) = 4/(-2) we will find k 2/(k-2) = -2 2 = (-2)*(k-2) -1 = k-2 1 = k checking with Slope2 we have 6/(k-4) = 6/(1–4) = 6/(-3) = -2
